Windows:
1. Download CLI using URL: https://${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_HOST}:${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_PORT}/pipeline/pipe.zip
2. Extract archieve to C:\Users\<YOUR_NAME>\pipe
- Navigate to C:\Users\<YOUR_NAME>\Downloads
- Right-click 'pipe.zip' and click 'Extract all'
- Enter 'C:\Users\<YOUR_NAME>\pipe\' in the 'Destination path'
- Click 'Extract'
3. Open Windows Console and add CLI to the PATH
- Click 'Start' and run 'cmd' application
- In the Console window type 'setx PATH \
MacOS:
# This option provides a distribution for the Mac devices with Intel chips
# Tarball shall be unpacked manually after downloading
cd ~
wget --no-check-certificate 'https://${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_HOST}:${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_PORT}/pipeline/pipe-osx.tar.gz'
tar -zxf pipe-osx.tar.gz
rm -f pipe-osx.tar.gz
export PATH=${CP_DOLLAR}PATH:~/pipe/
# Enable trust to the application
xattr -d com.apple.quarantine ~/pipe/*
MacOS-ARM:
# This option provides a distribution for the Mac devices with ARM-based chips (Apple Silicon)
# Tarball shall be unpacked manually after downloading
cd ~
wget --no-check-certificate 'https://${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_HOST}:${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_PORT}/pipeline/pipe-osx-arm.tar.gz'

Source:
# pipe CLI can be installed from a source tarball
# This requires the Python 2 or Python 3 environment to be available
mkdir -p ~/pipe
wget --no-check-certificate 'https://${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_HOST}:${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_PORT}/pipeline/PipelineCLI.tar.gz' -O ~/pipe/PipelineCLI.tar.gz
pip install --user ~/pipe/PipelineCLI.tar.gz
